intro: Echites leptolobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed echites, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Echites leptolobus is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
